xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
This module provides an XQuery API to full-text functions. For general information about this implementation of the XQuery and XPath Full Text 1.0 specification as well as instructions for building an installing a thesaurus, see the Full Text Thesaurus documentation.
Notes on languages To refer to particular human languages, uses either the ISO 639-1 or ISO 639-2 languages codes. Note that only a subset of the complete list of language codes are supported and not every function supports the same subset.
Most functions in this module take a language as a parameter using the xs:language XML schema data type.
Notes on stemming The stem() functions return the stem of a word. The stem of a word itself, however, is not guaranteed to be a word. It is best to consider a stem as an opaque byte sequence. All that is guaranteed about a stem is that, for a given word, the stem of that word will always be the same byte sequence. Hence, you should never compare the result of one of the stem() functions against a non-stemmed string, for example:
if ( ft:stem( "apples" ) eq "apple" ) ** WRONG **
Instead do:
if ( ft:stem( "apples" ) eq ft:stem( "apple" ) ) ** CORRECT **
Notes on the thesaurus The thesaurus-lookup() functions have "levels" and "relationship" parameters. The values for these are implementation-defined. The default implementation uses the WordNet lexical database, version 3.0.
In WordNet, the number of "levels" that two phrases are apart are how many hierarchical meanings apart they are. For example, "canary" is 5 levels away from "vertebrate" (carary > finch > oscine > passerine > bird > vertebrate).
When using the WordNet implementation, all of the relationships (and their abbreviations) specified by ISO 2788 and ANSI/NISO Z39.19-2005 with the exceptions of "HN" (history note) and "X SN" (see scope note for) are supported. These relationships are:
Rel. Meaning WordNet Rel.
BT broader term hypernym
BTG broader term generic hypernym
BTI broader term instance instance hypernym
BTP broader term partitive part meronym
NT narrower term hyponym
NTG narrower term generic hyponym
NTI narrower term instance instance hyponym
NTP narrower term partitive part holonym
RT related term also see
SN scope note n/a
TT top term hypernym
UF non-preferred term n/a
USE preferred term n/a
Note that you can specify relationships either by their abbreviation or their meaning. Relationships are case-insensitive. In addition to the ISO 2788 and ANSI/NISO Z39.19-2005 relationships, All of the relationships offered by WordNet are also supported. These relationships are:
Relationship Meaning
also see
A word that is related to another, e.g., for "varnished" (furniture) one should also see "finished."
antonym
A word opposite in meaning to another, e.g., "light" is an antonym for "heavy."
attribute
A noun for which adjectives express values, e.g., "weight" is an attribute for which the adjectives "light" and "heavy" express values.
cause
A verb that causes another, e.g., "show" is a cause of "see."
derivationally related form
A word that is derived from a root word, e.g., "metric" is a derivationally related form of "meter."
derived from adjective
An adverb that is derived from an adjective, e.g., "correctly" is derived from the adjective "correct."
entailment
A verb that presupposes another, e.g., "snoring" entails "sleeping."
hypernym
A word with a broad meaning that more specific words fall under, e.g., "meal" is a hypernym of "breakfast."
hyponym
A word of more specific meaning than a general term applicable to it, e.g., "breakfast" is a hyponym of "meal."
instance hypernym
A word that denotes a category of some specific instance, e.g., "author" is an instance hypernym of "Asimov."
instance hyponym
A term that donotes a specific instance of some general category, e.g., "Asimov" is an instance hyponym of "author."
member holonym
A word that denotes a collection of individuals, e.g., "faculty" is a member holonym of "professor."
member meronym
A word that denotes a member of a larger group, e.g., a "person" is a member meronym of a "crowd."
part holonym
A word that denotes a larger whole comprised of some part, e.g., "car" is a part holonym of "engine."
part meronym
A word that denotes a part of a larger whole, e.g., an "engine" is part meronym of a "car."
participle of verb
An adjective that is the participle of some verb, e.g., "breaking" is the participle of the verb "break."
pertainym
An adjective that classifies its noun, e.g., "musical" is a pertainym in "musical instrument."
similar to
Similar, though not necessarily interchangeable, adjectives. For example, "shiny" is similar to "bright", but they have subtle differences.
substance holonym
A word that denotes a larger whole containing some constituent substance, e.g., "bread" is a substance holonym of "flour."
substance meronym
A word that denotes a constituant substance of some larger whole, e.g., "flour" is a substance meronym of "bread."
verb group
A verb that is a member of a group of similar verbs, e.g., "live" is in the verb group of "dwell", "live", "inhabit", etc.
Notes on tokenization For general information about the implementation of tokenization, including what constitutes a token, see the Full Text Tokenizer documentation.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: Paul J. Lucas

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Predeclared constant for the Danish xs:language.
Predeclared constant for the German xs:language.
Predeclared constant for the English xs:language.
Predeclared constant for the Spanish xs:language.
Predeclared constant for the Finnish xs:language.
Predeclared constant for the French xs:language.
Predeclared constant for the Hungarian xs:language.
Predeclared constant for the Italian xs:language.
Predeclared constant for the Dutch xs:language.
Predeclared constant for the Norwegian xs:language.
Predeclared constant for the Portuguese xs:language.
Predeclared constant for the Romanian xs:language.
Predeclared constant for the Russian xs:language.
Predeclared constant for the Swedish xs:language.
Predeclared constant for the Turkish xs:language.
Gets the current compare options.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: ft:current-compare-options
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function ft:current-compare-options() as object() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Gets the current language: either the language specified by the declare ft-option using language statement (if any) or the one returned by ft:host-lang() (if none).

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: ft:current-lang
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function ft:current-lang() as xs:language external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Gets the host's current language. The "host" is the computer on which the software is running. The host's current language is obtained as follows:
For *nix systems:
If setlocale(3) returns non-null, the language corresponding to that locale is used.
Else, if the LANG environment variable is set, that language is ued.
Otherwise, there is no default language.
For Windows systems, the language corresponding to the locale returned by the GetLocaleInfo() function is used.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: ft:host-lang
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function ft:host-lang() as xs:language external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Checks whether the given language is supported for stemming.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $lang The language to check.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: true only if the language is supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: ft:is-stem-lang-supported
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function ft:is-stem-lang-supported($lang as xs:language) as xs:boolean external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Checks whether the given word is a stop-word.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $word The word to check.
$lang The language of $word.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: true only if $word is a stop-word.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: err:FTST0009 if $lang is not supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: ft:is-stop-word
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function ft:is-stop-word($word as xs:string, $lang as xs:language) as xs:boolean external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Checks whether the given word is a stop-word.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $word The word to check. The word's language is assumed to be the one returned by ft:current-lang().
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: true only if $word is a stop-word.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: err:FTST0009 if ft:current-lang() is not supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: ft:is-stop-word
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function ft:is-stop-word($word as xs:string) as xs:boolean external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Checks whether the given language is supported for stop words.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $lang The language to check.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: true only if the language is supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: ft:is-stop-word-lang-supported
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function ft:is-stop-word-lang-supported($lang as xs:language) as xs:boolean external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Checks whether the given language is supported for look-up using the default thesaurus.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $lang The language to check.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: true only if the language is supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: ft:is-thesaurus-lang-supported
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function ft:is-thesaurus-lang-supported($lang as xs:language) as xs:boolean external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Checks whether the given language is supported for look-up using the thesaurus specified by the given URI.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $uri The URI specifying the thesaurus to use.
$lang The language to check.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: true only if the language is supported.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: err:FTST0018 if $uri refers to a thesaurus that is not found in the statically known thesauri.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: ft:is-thesaurus-lang-supported
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function ft:is-thesaurus-lang-supported($uri as xs:string, $lang as xs:language) as xs:boolean external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Checks whether the given language is supported for tokenization.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $lang The language to check.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: true only if the language is supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: ft:is-tokenizer-lang-supported
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function ft:is-tokenizer-lang-supported($lang as xs:language) as xs:boolean external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Stems the given word.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $word The word to stem.
$lang The language of $word.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: err:FTST0009 if $lang is not supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: ft:stem
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function ft:stem($word as xs:string, $lang as xs:language) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Stems the given word.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $word The word to stem. The word's language is assumed to be the one returned by ft:current-lang().
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: err:FTST0009 if ft:current-lang() is not supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: ft:stem
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function ft:stem($word as xs:string) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Strips all diacritical marks from all characters.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $string The string to strip diacritical marks from.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: ft:strip-diacritics
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function ft:strip-diacritics($string as xs:string) as xs:string external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Looks-up the given phrase in the default thesaurus.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $phrase The phrase to look up. The phrase's language is assumed to be the one returned by ft:current-lang().
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: the related phrases if $phrase is found in the thesaurus or the empty sequence if not.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: err:FTST0009 if ft:current-lang() is not supported.
zerr:ZXQP8401 if the thesaurus data file's version is not supported by the currently running version of the software.
zerr:ZXQP8402 if the thesaurus data file's endianness does not match that of the CPU on which the software is currently running.
zerr:ZXQP8403 if there was an error reading the thesaurus data.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: ft:thesaurus-lookup
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function ft:thesaurus-lookup($phrase as xs:string) as xs:string* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Looks-up the given phrase in the thesaurus specified by the given URI.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $uri The URI specifying the thesaurus to use.
$phrase The phrase to look up.
$lang The language of $phrase.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: the related phrases if $phrase is found in the thesaurus or the empty sequence if not.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: err:FTST0009 if $lang is not supported.
err:FTST0018 if $uri refers to a thesaurus that is not found in the statically known thesauri.
zerr:ZOSE0001 if the thesaurus data file could not be found.
zerr:ZOSE0002 if the thesaurus data file is not a plain file.
zerr:ZXQP8401 if the thesaurus data file's version is not supported by the currently running version of the software.
zerr:ZXQP8402 if the thesaurus data file's endianness does not match that of the CPU on which the software is currently running.
zerr:ZXQP8403 if there was an error reading the thesaurus data file.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: ft:thesaurus-lookup
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function ft:thesaurus-lookup($uri as xs:string, $phrase as xs:string, $lang as xs:language) as xs:string* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Looks-up the given phrase in a thesaurus.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $uri The URI specifying the thesaurus to use.
$phrase The phrase to look up. The phrase's language is assumed to be the one the one returned by ft:current-lang().
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: the related phrases if $phrase is found in the thesaurus or the empty sequence if not.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: err:FTST0009 if ft:current-lang() is unsupported.
err:FTST0018 if $uri refers to a thesaurus that is not found in the statically known thesauri.
zerr:ZOSE0001 if the thesaurus data file could not be found.
zerr:ZOSE0002 if the thesaurus data file is not a plain file.
zerr:ZXQP8401 if the thesaurus data file's version is not supported by the currently running version of the software.
zerr:ZXQP8402 if the thesaurus data file's endianness does not match that of the CPU on which the software is currently running.
zerr:ZXQP8403 if there was an error reading the thesaurus data file.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: ft:thesaurus-lookup
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function ft:thesaurus-lookup($uri as xs:string, $phrase as xs:string) as xs:string* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Looks-up the given phrase in a thesaurus.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $uri The URI specifying the thesaurus to use.
$phrase The phrase to look up.
$lang The language of $phrase.
$relationship The relationship the results are to have to $phrase.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: the related phrases if $phrase is found in the thesaurus or the empty sequence if not.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: err:FTST0018 if $uri refers to a thesaurus that is not found in the statically known thesauri.
err:FTST0009 if $lang is not supported.
zerr:ZOSE0001 if the thesaurus data file could not be found.
zerr:ZOSE0002 if the thesaurus data file is not a plain file.
zerr:ZXQP8401 if the thesaurus data file's version is not supported by the currently running version of the software.
zerr:ZXQP8402 if the thesaurus data file's endianness does not match that of the CPU on which the software is currently running.
zerr:ZXQP8403 if there was an error reading the thesaurus data file.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: ft:thesaurus-lookup
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function ft:thesaurus-lookup($uri as xs:string, $phrase as xs:string, $lang as xs:language, $relationship as xs:string) as xs:string* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Looks-up the given phrase in a thesaurus.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $uri The URI specifying the thesaurus to use.
$phrase The phrase to look up.
$lang The language of $phrase.
$relationship The relationship the results are to have to $phrase.
$level-least The minimum number of levels within the thesaurus to be traversed.
$level-most The maximum number of levels within the thesaurus to be traversed.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: the related phrases if $phrase is found in the thesaurus or the empty sequence if not.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: err:FOCA0003 if either $level-least or $level-most is either negative or too large.
err:FTST0018 if $uri refers to a thesaurus that is not found in the statically known thesauri.
err:FTST0009 if $lang is not supported.
zerr:ZOSE0001 if the thesaurus data file could not be found.
zerr:ZOSE0002 if the thesaurus data file is not a plain file.
zerr:ZXQP8401 if the thesaurus data file's version is not supported by the currently running version of the software.
zerr:ZXQP8402 if the thesaurus data file's endianness does not match that of the CPU on which the software is currently running.
zerr:ZXQP8403 if there was an error reading the thesaurus data file.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: ft:thesaurus-lookup
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function ft:thesaurus-lookup($uri as xs:string, $phrase as xs:string, $lang as xs:language, $relationship as xs:string, $level-least as xs:integer, $level-most as xs:integer) as xs:string* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Tokenizes the given node and all of its decendants.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $node The node to tokenize.
$lang The default language of $node.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: err:FTST0009 if $lang is not supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: ft:tokenize-node
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function ft:tokenize-node($node as node(), $lang as xs:language) as object()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Tokenizes the given node and all of its descendants.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $node The node to tokenize. The node's default language is assumed to be the one returned by ft:current-lang().
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: err:FTST0009 if ft:current-lang() is not supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: ft:tokenize-node
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function ft:tokenize-node($node as node()) as object()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Tokenizes the set of nodes comprising $includes (and all of its descendants) but excluding $excludes (and all of its descendants), if any.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $includes The set of nodes (and its descendants) to include. The default language is assumed to be the one returned by ft:current-lang().
$excludes The set of nodes (and its descendants) to exclude.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: err:FTST0009 if ft:current-lang() is not supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: ft:tokenize-nodes
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function ft:tokenize-nodes($includes as node()+, $excludes as node()*) as object()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Tokenizes the set of nodes comprising $includes (and all of its descendants) but excluding $excludes (and all of its descendants), if any.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $includes The set of nodes (and its descendants) to include.
$excludes The set of nodes (and its descendants) to exclude.
$lang The default language for nodes.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: err:FTST0009 if $lang is not supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: ft:tokenize-nodes
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function ft:tokenize-nodes($includes as node()+, $excludes as node()*, $lang as xs:language) as object()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Tokenizes the given string.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $string The string to tokenize.
$lang The language of $string.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: err:FTST0009 if $lang is not supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: ft:tokenize-string
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function ft:tokenize-string($string as xs:string, $lang as xs:language) as xs:string* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Tokenizes the given string.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $string The string to tokenize. The string's language is assumed to be the one returned by ft:current-lang().
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: err:FTST0009 if ft:current-lang() is not supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: ft:tokenize-string
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function ft:tokenize-string($string as xs:string) as xs:string* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Gets properties of the tokenizer for the given language.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $lang The language of the tokenizer to get the properties of.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: err:FTST0009 if $lang is not supported. tokenization specifically.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: ft:tokenizer-properties
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function ft:tokenizer-properties($lang as xs:language) as object() external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Gets properties of the tokenizer for the language returned by ft:current-lang().
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: err:FTST0009 if ft:current-lang() is not supported.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: ft:tokenizer-properties
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function ft:tokenizer-properties() as object() external
